main event: An observer reported seeing a moving object with a white front and a bluish tail in Colorado Springs on December 13, 1955.
interesting points: The object was observed flying rapidly for about 5 to 6 seconds., The object had a flat trajectory and flew straight towards the east., It was described as being V-shaped and the size of a silver dollar at arm's length., The object was noted to have a bluish trail that spread out and appeared similar to sparks., The conclusion suggested that the object was likely an astronomical meteor.
sighted object: a large object with a white color at the front and a bluish trail
witness description: 2/LT Joseph R. Beigg (copilot) and CAPT Garfield W. Slurett (pilot)
